Description: Fragment of an open vessel in translucent purple and opaque white cameo glass. The decoration, in white, shows an Egyptian head, probably female, with hair (or wig) in locks and a diadem. The head is surmounted by the lower part of a crown, comprising a plinth above which elements (now missing) rose. The presence of the crown suggests that the female is either a goddess or a queen.
Bibliographic references: Tatton-Brown et al 2007 / Roman Cameo Glass (21)
Roberts et al 2010 / Roman Cameo Glass in the British Museum (21)
Glass 2 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass, Volume 2 (752)
